intro: Hieracium melanops subsp. mairanum, commonly known as the dark hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. The plant features basal rosettes of dark green, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers in a single, erect stem. Its flowers are typically arranged in a single head, with ray florets that are often shorter than the disk florets. The species is characterized by its distinctive leaf morphology and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
